availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. M. Cardwell (Marion County, Ky, druggist)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, druggist. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Cardwell. Father of Bettie L. Cardwell, Richard Cardwell, Ellen Cardwell. Druggist in Lebanon, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Lebanon in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 548.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 10.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 74A.
"Dr. J. M. Cardwell (1821-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #114265649, accessed April 22, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114265649.
"Notes of Current Events," Interior Journal (Stanford, KY), March 6, 1885, p. 2.
